meanings.definition: Inability to write due to brain injury or disease.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he developed agraphias and could no longer write.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed her with agraphias after noticing her struggle to write legibly.
meanings.sent3: The agraphias made his handwriting look like a spider had danced across the page.
meanings.sent4: Her agraphias turned her once neat handwriting into a chaotic jumble of letters.
meanings.sent5: The agraphias painted a frustrating barrier between his thoughts and the paper.

meanings.definition: Impairment in the ability to write.
meanings.sent1: The student's agraphias affected his schoolwork as he couldn't write essays.
meanings.sent2: She sought help to overcome her agraphias and improve her writing skills.
meanings.sent3: His agraphias seemed to play a prank on him every time he picked up a pen.
meanings.sent4: The agraphias cast a shadow over her dream of becoming a writer.
meanings.sent5: Overcoming agraphias felt like unlocking a door to a world of words and stories.

meanings.definition: Condition characterized by difficulty in writing.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that her agraphias were causing the writing challenges.
meanings.sent2: He practiced daily to lessen the impact of his agraphias on his handwriting.
meanings.sent3: The agraphias seemed to enjoy playing hide-and-seek with her writing skills.
meanings.sent4: Her agraphias turned the blank page into a battlefield of scribbles.
meanings.sent5: The struggle with agraphias taught him patience and perseverance in writing.
